section.name: ToolWindow Types
section.p: A tool window can be showed in several ways. A ToolWindowType is used to choose between different viewing modes. Now we describe the types provided.

ul.li:
ToolWindowType.DOCKED - When DOCKED type is used, the tool window shares frame space and fixes to a docking area along one of the tool window bars (the one containing the corresponding representative button).
To set ToolWindowType.DOCKED type use the following: ToolWindow toolWindow = toolWindowManager.getToolWindow("Debug Tool"); toolWindow.setType(ToolWindowType.DOCKED);

ToolWindowType.FLOATING - This type enables a tool window to be detached from the main window frame. When Floating type is used, the tool window detaches to the position where it was last floated (or screen center or location setted for toolwindow's FloatingTypeDescriptor , if never before floated)
To set ToolWindowType.FLOATING type use the following: ToolWindow toolWindow = toolWindowManager.getToolWindow("Debug Tool"); toolWindow.setType(ToolWindowType.FLOATING);

section.name: ToolWindow Type Descriptors
section.p: A ToolWindowTypeDescriptor is an interface to modify the behaviours of a specific tool window type.
